channel.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
channel.description:
Does Microsoft not deserve as much credit as you give them?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MDNuq94Zg_8
^^That guy says they didn't but people say they did. Post your thoughts.
I think the shits copied just named different.. lol & that guys a damn fool.

item.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

[quote=“Monster Hack, post:39, topic:56029”]Computards wouldn’t know what to look up, or understand lots.
Thats the thing, trust me, I live with one.

-Mh[/quote]

Lol so do I

[quote=“Monster Hack, post:42, topic:56029”]The video is a joke.
Notice the “V” for Vista flashes to the Mac OS X logo?

As for Microsoft taking from Apple, where do you think Apple got lots of their ideas from too?
Like in the beginning, where did they get it from?

-Mh[/quote]

Ok… maybe it is a joke but, theres other serious videos & things about this topic so. Yeah…

item.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Monster Hack:

Apple makes it so easy, that even a totally and uderly computards can produce videos or slideshows.

I must disagree. While Apples come with the software pre-installed it takes a 5 min search and a 5 min read of a tutorial to make the same in Windows. Honestly, anyone with a brain that knows about Google can do anything they want on windows.

Read full topic
item.source: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?

item.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Who honestly gives a flying fuck if the Widgets and Gadgets are ‘ripped’, or a few other features.
The point is that Windows is better for certain things, as where Macs aren’t and vice versa.
Apple makes it so easy, that even a totally and uderly computards can produce videos or slideshows.
I have yet to really hear about how Apple’s OS is in their comercials, I just hear user-friendly features.
Atleast Microsoft is sort of talking about it.
Either way, Windows might have a few features that Mac does, but where the hell do you think Apple got lots of their ideas?
Toolbars, Start menu, Windowstate functions, and other components from? Well we could say Microsoft because it was pretty much the first OS with proper UI, or so I have been led to believe.

Therefore, anyone who talks about how Microsoft ‘stole’ from Apple should shut the hell up and worry about serious matters in the world if they are going to worry about anything.
Like the amount of people who die each day due to not having any water.

-Mh

Read full topic
item.source: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?

item.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:23, topic:56029”]I really couldn’t care less if Vista ripped OS X or if OS X ripped Vista. Linux distros ftw.

Lil story:- I go to a training place on Tuesdays and Thursdays and do a web design course, some people there do media, one of them is called Steve. He was on a OS X doing some video editing(he’s now a camera man for Plymouth Argyle), anyways he was messing about with the Mac OS X’s mouse and managed to zoom right in to the mouse pointer’s location. Me and about 3 other people couldn’t stop laughing. In the end he had to restart it before the teacher found out. :p[/quote]
u made me spill my coffee laughing u bastard !

Read full topic
item.source: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?

item.title: Did Microsoft rip-off Apple Mac OS X in Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I really couldn’t care less if Vista ripped OS X or if OS X ripped Vista. Linux distros ftw.

Lil story:- I go to a training place on Tuesdays and Thursdays and do a web design course, some people there do media, one of them is called Steve. He was on a OS X doing some video editing(he’s now a camera man for Plymouth Argyle), anyways he was messing about with the Mac OS X’s mouse and managed to zoom right in to the mouse pointer’s location. Me and about 3 other people couldn’t stop laughing. In the end he had to restart it before the teacher found out.

Read full topic
